title: Japanese apparel firms give new life to their old clothes
summary: Firms in Japan's fashion industry are increasingly making efforts to reduce waste by reselling used clothes of their brand that are in good enough condition. Companies like Sanyo Shokai and Uniqlo have initiated programs to collect and resell secondhand apparel, contributing to the cycle of resources.
business_innovation: TRUE; The firms are introducing new processes for reselling used clothing, which differs significantly from their previous practices, thus qualifying as a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE; The resale of used clothes aligns with the definition of a green product as it promotes sustainability by reducing waste and extending the lifecycle of clothing items.
green_process: TRUE; The process of collecting, checking, and reselling used clothes demonstrates a method that minimizes environmental impacts by promoting reuse and waste reduction.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 424310 - Piece Goods, Notions, and Other Dry Goods Merchant Wholesalers, 448190 - Other Clothing Stores, 315280 - Other Cut and Sew Apparel Manufacturing, 812310 - Coin-Operated Laundries and Drycleaners
